page.title: 05The Plough Car Park Problem.
page.content: The Plough public house in Endon was given permission,by the local district council,to extend by building a carvery and a new porch.The number of patrons increased considerably.However, when the car park was full,motorists would leave their cars on the roadside next to the Plough.This often caused homeowners'drives to be blocked and complaints ensued.The brewery applied to buy Clifton House,a fine Victorian dwelling,next to the Plough.They were intending to demolish it to make room to enlarge the car park.Many local residents' thoughts were against this because of the dwelling's architectural and historical merits.After much discussion the district council gave permission for the scheme in January 1985.The brewery agreed to pay the owners 60,000 pounds to purchase Clifton House.
